title: Canadian geography. No. 1. Physical regions of Canada
creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: A study of the physical and economic geography of Canada on the basis of six natural divisions: the Pacific Coast region, the Great Plains, the Laurentian Shield, the St. Lawrence Lowlands, the Atlantic region and the Arctic Islands. In each region the film interprets the relationship of topography, climate and natural resources to the industries or occupations of its inhabitants.
